CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 14, 1955, pg. 7, reads: "NAACP Play Cast - The cast and some of the color of the NAACP pageant, "Milestones of Democracy," was caught by the photographer at Wesley Center AME Zion Church Sunday afternoon, May 1. The pageant, written by Mrs. Carrie Lovett, and directed by Mrs. Helen Dandridge, was sponsored by the NAACP Women's Auxiliary to kick-off the current membership campaign.  The cast, which depicted origin and progress of the NAACP, are group (1), seated left to right, Cheryl and Billye Gambrell; standing, left to right, William Coleman, Mary James, Essie Roberts, Corp. Shadrack Moon, Esther Bolden, Torrence Paul, Iona Rav, Catherine Stewart, Lieut. Egbert Thompson, Gladys Golightly and Bessie Norwood... - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Cast of NAACP pageant "Milestones of Democracy," seated from left: Cheryl and Billye Gambrell; standing: William Coleman, Mary James, Essie Roberts, Shadrack Moon, Esther Bolden, Torrence Paul, Iona Rav, Catherine Stewart, Egbert Thompson, Gladys Golightly holding quilt, and Bessie Norwood holding rifle, at Wesley Center AME Zion Church
